Posts.Content: Hi, book up with M & S and ask for someone who has been trained for masectomys. My breast care nurse recommended this and said no under wiring, alos sports bras are no good as getting them over your head will be a bit difficult. I also got bra extension hooks which help, just make sure you get the correct ones, either 2 or 3 hooks. M & S do wonderful post op bra but its like a hammock but its so comfortable. Good luck Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Post Surgery Bras!!

Posts.Content: Hi, if you carry on with the phsyio exceries they will help but you should have been given a phone number for the phsio or you bcn will be able to. To stop myself from using my at risk arm i wear a fashion glove on it whenever i am out shopping so if i put a bag in that hand i know to swap hands immediately. I have in the last few days being getting pulling in that arm so i have started to do my physio excersies again from when i had masectomy. Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Celia, go out and enjoy life to the full Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Well done on getting through the op. skin sparring masectomy, i have never heard of that but it is nice to wake from the op and see a bump there. I hope that all goes well on 13th. Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi, what i was told about my chest expander is that when they do the masectomy the breast muscle is removed so the chest expander is not there to expand the skin it to expand the muscle which is usually infront of the ribs to protect them. They use that muscle and as its only been used to being infront of the ribs the muscle has to be stretched gradually like when pregnant and your insides grow gradually over the 9 months. This muscle goes over the permant implant. Does anyone know how long permanent implants last, i have heard its 10 to 15 years? Take Car Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi, i remeber how scared i was at the beginning of the year, i didnt even have a clue about node sampling so you are doing very well to be taking it all in at this stage. i had masectomy with node sample, it had spread so had to have nodes removed followed by chemo and currently haveing radiotherapy. Everyone i have spoken to has had node sample even if it is a lumpectomy. Its is best to get this sorted out now because if it has spread it will be very early stages and can be fought better with chemo, etc. I am on tamoxifen which is used for pre and post menopausal, side effect vary with all the drugs from person to person. My advise is take one step at a time. focus on the operation first and then the results will follow about 10days after that. dont worry we will all be here to help you every step of the way. Good luck with the op. Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi, i know what you mean about expect the worse then when its not as bad then its a nice surprise. i did that with chemo and got someone who had a bad time tell me the worset and it wasnt as bad as i thought it would be, op pain after is not too bad just keep on asking for pain killers and then ask for more!!! i went to M & S before op and saw someone there who will measure you up and give you one slightly too big, rest lots after the op. Jims girl, i am very impressed with you doing all this at 72!!! After my RT finishes i will be having proper implants put in but you have inspired me to get Â nipple done later too. take care love kaz x
Posts.Title: Node sampling and mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi, i am due to start tamoxifen on 30th july, i didnt even know that there were different brands but looked at instructions and its Wockhardt. Dont know if that helps. What side effects did you have ? Kaz x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen - do different brands have different side effects?

Posts.Content: Hi, i am due to start tamoxifen on 30th july, i didnt even know that there were different brands but looked at instructions and its Wockhardt. Dont know if that helps. What side effects did you have ? Kaz x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen - do different brands have different side effects?

Posts.Content: Well done Celia, i hope you went out and partied BIG!!!!!! Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: ALL CLEAR

Posts.Content: Hi Binky, i start RT on tuesday but my friend has started it. Nurses said only use aqueous cream, which you can get from docs, and to wash with 'simple' shower gel or 'simple' bubble bath. these are the only products that dont have metals in them. It does feel sore after about a week and tiredness can be due to having to go to hospital every day. Also bra's can irritate skin so might have to use vest tops instead. Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Radio therapy - cream/oil?

Posts.Content: Hi, i havent had ovaries removed but i finished treatment in 2010 and had oestrogen check which showed low level of 27, normal person is about 125, couple of months ago after a couple of bleeds i was refered to gynea where oestrogen level was 758, so they did biopsy of uterus, thankfully was clear, but have to have injections into stomache to stop oestrogen. If i could i would have ovaries removed so that i would i know that i had done everything i could to stop cancer coming back. Its all about peace of mind for me.Take care Love Kaz
Posts.Title: Anyone had ovaries removed as a precaution?

Posts.Content: hi ive had masectomy to left side and full node clearance in February, my upper arm and pit get sharpe pains and tingling and numberness in which may never go, i did speak to surgeon about it and i have gabapentin which i still take but it is so much better. Keep doing exercies and rubb with baby oil morning and nights. It has only been 10 days so should get better with time x
Posts.Title: Sticky armpit!

Posts.Content: Hi, i have been on tamoxifen since Aug 2010 and didnt have any periods till christmas. Went to doctors who sent me for internal ultrasound and it showed a typical tamoxifen uterus thickening. When i had oncology appointment 2 weeks ago, they were not happy with that and have made appointment for gynea on 30th April. I would speak to oncology team as they are the experts and they said to me they may change me from tamoxifen to another hormone drug depending on outcome. Take care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: tamoxifen and periods

Posts.Content: Hi Connor, just wanted to say good luck on Tuesday, i can assure you, i will be thinking of you but i go back to work on Monday, after having over one year off, anyway, you are brave and YOU CAN DO THIS!!!!! Look at the kids and know that you are doing this for them and they will give you strength. Take lots and lots of care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: bad news again

Posts.Content: Hi Lorraine, eat whatever you fancy, its a bit like being pregnant with cravings, sickness and certain food you are not allowed, like salads are best avoided as they cant be washed properly, blue cheeses, rare steak, runny eggs etc. Depending on what drug you are on, your taste buds will go and everything tastes horrible, even water. When i had this i got meal replacement drinks, strawberry milkshake was the best and also mixed it with vanilla ice cream so it was like a macdonalds milkshake. Take care love Kaz x
Posts.Title: What's best to eat while on Chemo??

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, i had hickman line fitted after my first session of chemo for breast cancer as they said my veins would not last for the rest of chemo but it was all done through nhs. I would have thought it would be very expensive as you have to have the line cleaned every week while you have it fitted but i must admit it was wonderful and i am so glad that i had it. Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Hickman line

Posts.Content: Hi, i know its hard not to worry but please just try to take one step at a time. Have they done a biopsy yet, thats the next step if they feel you need it. Sometimes they call you in just to say the mammogram is clear. If it is a biopsy, dont worry, they will give you plenty of local so you dont feel it and then its another wait for them to grow the cells and that may come back as ok. Waiting is the hard bit but you will be fine, if its cancer its been caught early and we are here with you every step of the way. Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Worried about the assessment

Posts.Content: Sharon, well done for coming to the right decision. Take Care love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Bridie, yes i LOVE my tissue expander, its makes me feel young again!!!! LOL
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon, please dont take a chance, its just not worth it. Have you spoken to your consultant about reconstruction as that might make you feel better about it all. Dont forget one stray cancer cell is all it takes. Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,Â  Sharon please get the strength and speak to GP to get it all sorted, you are stronger than you think and you will get through this. Michelle, good luck with your double masectomy, its so scarry but you are definatly doing the right thing. Be brave and ask for a sedative before to try and calm yourself down as i did that and it did help. Bridie, i have chest expander in left and will hope fully having permant implants in both in december, what is a risk reducing masectomy i have never heard of that? Take Care Everyone love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi, sorry to hear your news. I know its scarry but please think very carefully before refusing treatment. I had single masectomy in feb and went for chest expander in readiness for permant implants on both sides at a later date. When i came round from op i looked down and there was a boob there which gets expanded every week for 4 weeks, so it was not so bad. I did find out a week later and had to have nodes out as had spread followed by chemo and RT which i have just finished. I was so scared of the chemo that i fainted but apart from that it was not as bad as i thought it would be so please, please do whatever the docs say. Now in hindsight i wish i had asked for double masectomy so its all over and done with - now i never thought i would have said that at the beginning of the year!!!! Please take care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon, good luck today, please listen to what they say. You are stronger than you thinkÂ  Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Michelle, good luck on monday, you will be fine i promise, If they offer you any drugs before and after, just take them, thats my advise. even if not in pain just keep taking and then you will sleep loads. I made one of best friends in hospital as they put all breast patients together so you will have a good gossip before and after. Sharon, well done and i am glad you have sorted out your masectomy, you can do it!!!! Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Sally, this sounds wierd but its good that you are crying and not building it up inside. Thats what i did as i couldn't accept that i had cancer even after i had masectomy so when i went in for my first chemo session, i fainted as reality had set in. Still havent cried apart from when i was told that it had spread to lymph nodes. So now i am back at work, in a call centre and i just know that someone is going to come on the phone and i will dissolve into hysterics within the next few months. Everyone phoneing call centres be warned!!!!! Everyone does react differently but you will get through it. Main bit of advise is to be selfish, rest lots and eat whatever you feel like eating but always put yourself first and anyone who offers help, take it. Good luck Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: New to group- so scared of whats to come...

Posts.Content: Hi, I had both nipples recontructed in August and i love them so much. I had to have the padding on for about 3 weeks. They are amazing and i cant wait to have tattoos for areolas. Once they say the padding with the middle can come off then you will be ok to lie on them. They put plastic covers on mine with air holes to let the skin breath but they do flatten out alot when protective padding comes off. I thought they would really show through the clothes and i would look errect all the time but i dont now and i wear crop top bras.Take care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Nipple Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Elicia, I have just finished my 6 cycles of FEC-T and its the docetaxel that makes everything taste awful, even water was awful, last for about 3 weeks on last session. I have masectomy in feb followed by lymph node removeal. When i have masectomy they encourage me to have reconstruction at same time. As i have no spare tissue, at that time i was small but now they would find spare tissue!!!, They gave me a temporary implant that was inflated every week for 4 weeks with saline. I am about to start RT and they have told me to contact surgeon 4 weeks after i have finished all treatment so they can do permant implants in both. Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Surgery and taste buds

Posts.Content: OMG..... i have just had appointment through for gynea and am shitting myself. Just finished all my treatment for breast cancer, had masectomy, chemo RT and reconstruction since Jan 2010 and have been on tamoxifen since Aug 2010. Had two periods just before christmas 2011 and doc sent me for internal ultrasound and they said it was a typical tamoxifen thick uterus lining so not to worry.Â Had check up with oncology 2 weeks ago and they were not happy when i told them and have refered me to gynea on 30th April. Trying to get me head round it and prepare myself mentally as i was convinced that i didnt have breast cancer. My advice definatly go to the doctor and get it checked out, if you are in touch with your oncologist then go directly to them. Good luck and keep in touch. Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and Methotrexate (for RA) - Still Having Period??

Posts.Content: Hi Claire, sorry i cant give you any advise about the operation but just wanted to say how brave you are and well done for making the right descision, especially as you are so young. Take Care Love Kaz x Â
Posts.Title: Ovary Removal

Posts.Content: Hi i am due to start taking tamoxifen in 3 weeks as just finished chemo and due to start radio in 4 weeks time. i am premenopausal and had masectomy, Grad 2 BC. I was worried about being told only to take for 2-3 years and not the ususal 5 years and i am also worried about bone density and overain cancer. can anyone give me adivise.Many thanks Kaz
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen It Sounds Awful Is it Really That Bad?

Posts.Content: Hi, i have been on tamoxifen for nearly one month now and i certainly notice the hot flushes. They come for 5 mins and then go. its so weird. I am eating less but still have not lost any weight so i assume it must be due to these pills, also my sleeping is very erratic, takes ages to get to sleep and when i do i wake up a few hours later and then it takes ages to go back. A bit down at the moment so have just got anti depressents from docs, Citalopram, hopefully they will help. Take Care Everyone Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen It Sounds Awful Is it Really That Bad?

Posts.Content: Hi, please dont worry about implants, i went on holiday x2 with chest expander implants and permant implants and they do not change due to cabin pressure. I was worried that the port for the saline in temporary implant would go off through security but its plastic and ok. Enjoy yourself. Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Implants and flying

Posts.Content: Hi honey, i have had masectomy and found out spread to lymph nodes so then had total lymph node removal.Â  My upper arm felt very numb and tingly after with sharp pains so i now take gabapentin which helps so much.Â  i am halfway through chemo and you will get through it, it is so scary of the unkown so give yourself a treat after every session
Posts.Title: bc with alot underarm lymph node involvement

Posts.Content: Hi Joan, for some reason i felt sick a few times before i had RT so i took one of my anti sickness tablets left over from chemo and felt alot better. Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Side Affects of radiotherapy?

Posts.Content: Hi. My hair came out in handfull 3 weeks after my first FEC cycle, i had it cut short like a boys and put on ski caps so did not leave hair all over the house, after 3 days i thought 'what is the point' i was wearing hat anyway. i got my daughter to cut it really short in the garden which looked stupid so i got my electric bikini shaver and it worked with them.Â  I put a tiny bit of oil or cream on my head as scalp is a bit dry. i do suggest that you buy a few ski hats or scarfs as it is amazing how much colder you are with no hair. my ears are always cold and so is my neck.
Posts.Title: Anyone got advice on how to shave your head?

Posts.Content: Hi Joan, yes same happened to me so i just held the seat belt and now i am driving again i keep a big scarf in my car and pad out where the seat belt goes across my chest. Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Advice re seat belts!

Posts.Content: Hi, hopefully you will have been in touch with your breast care nurse by now but thought i would let you know that last year when i was half way through chemo, a lump appeared on my neck, i told the oncologist and had scan a few days later and it was nothing, its still there but has gone down a bit.Â  Good luck Kaz x
Posts.Title: Just finished treatment,found new lump

Posts.Content: Hi, i have had risk reducing masectomy to other side andÂ the relief was amazing. Feel so much better even though you are never 100% sure. I have had a couple of periods recently and told my doctor who sent me for internal scan but oncology appointment was a couple of weeks ago and they have given me appointment with gynea, hoping its just to be on the safe side!!! Tell your docotor and then tell your oncology team in 2 weeks time as the results of any tests should be through by then. Good luck Love Kaz
Posts.Title: healthy breast????

Posts.Content: its so hard what to say to kids, i have breast cancer and it has spread to lymph nodes but i have them removed and am going through chemo, so just to reassure we can beat this THING!!!! I have 3 teenage daughters and it is so hard explaining things to them. Keep it simple as possible and tell them the truth and dont make promises that cant be kept otherwise they may never trust you again. Good luck x
Posts.Title: What to say to the kids?

Posts.Content: Ladies, just re read what i put down and when i said i took lorazepam for 18 months i meant to say only a couple of days every month for the last 18 months, it sounded like i took them every night, sorry if i mis lead you all. Take care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: sleep

Posts.Content: Oh Larazepam are wonderful and i use them when i am at my witts end and desparate for a good nights sleep. I have used them these last 18 months and since my mum has had stroke, 3 weeks ago and i coulnt sleep, i have for the last 3 nights taken Nytol, not the herbal ones though, i tried herbal kalms but they did nothing. Nytol is good, not as good as lorazepam but should help you. Good luck and take care Kaz x
Posts.Title: sleep

Posts.Content: Hi Vicky, i am so sorry to hear your news. I had masectomy in feb 2010 followed with chemo and rt and reconstruction. I had on 1st August this year risk reducing masectomy to other side. When this journey first started a couple of people i know had both sides done but did warn me that you have to persude the surgeon to do it and also they dont usually do it at same time in case you are just in shock from getting the cancer news. I did have to argue my case but you do have to be in the right frame of mind to go up against them. Please take care of yourself, you sound like you are very strong Kaz x
Posts.Title: Secondaries leading to diagnosis of new primary in other breast

Posts.Content: Hi, my personal advice would be masectomy. I had left masectomy last year and just had reconstruction, i am now in the process of trying to get the right side as a risk reducing masectomy. If i can avoid going through chemo and RT again then i will. But thats me and my best friend had lumpectomy and she is not interested in having masectomy. Only you know what right for you. Take care and good luck Kaz x
Posts.Title: mastectomy v breast conservation - discus

Posts.Content: Hi Hotchoc, i had both sides with implant in but only left side for masectomy so i am meeting with my surgeon in a months time, after my holidays, to talk about getting the right side done. I am a bit uneven, the masectomy side is so pert and the implant side has a bit of a droop but is fine with light control bra on. I had to have chest expander in as a temporary measure when i had masectomy as there was no excess tissue. There is plenty of now as i have put on so much weight this last year. LOL. Take care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: mastectomy v breast conservation - discus

Posts.Content: Hi tina, god i hope that the results come back ok. your right, you should be out enjoying yourself. I have BC and had masectomy, chemo, just about to start RT and i have chest expander in. What is tripple negative, i have BC which is oestrogen feed and positive but would like to know what negative is. Take Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Rash on new boob- Onc thinks it could be skin mets :-(

Posts.Content: Hi Tina, i am so sorry to hear your news, you must be devastated. did you go to V festival, have you had to cancel holiday? What surgery are you having next week? I really and truly hope that you are ok and you can rant away to us all as much as you like. We are here for you.Â  Take lots of Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Rash on new boob- Onc thinks it could be skin mets :-(

Posts.Content: Hi Tina, i am so sorry to hear your news, you must be devastated. did you go to V festival, have you had to cancel holiday? What surgery are you having next week? I really and truly hope that you are ok and you can rant away to us all as much as you like. We are here for you.Â  Take lots of Care Love Kaz x
Posts.Title: Rash on new boob- Onc thinks it could be skin mets :-(

Posts.Content: Hi Caz, i was diagnosed in jan 2010, had left mesectomy, chemo, rt and reconstruction. i was off work for 13 months and it was only after i returned to work that i slowly became more confident. I went on holiday with my family after about one month of being back at work and that helped me to relax and get used to being a new me. I have just had risk reducing masectomy to right side and have lost a bit of my confidence again but i know that i will get it back after a few weeks. Please just take your time and do things at a slow pace. You have changed and things will never be the same, get used to a NEW you. Take care love Kaz x
Posts.Title: low confidence help
